page.discussion: The SESSION_VARIABLES() function returns a pointer to the collection of session (or shared) variables. Session variables are declared at the form or browse level, and are available as long as the form/browse and its sister browse/form (displayed by pressing F8) remain loaded.

section.example: dim ptr as P dim var as P dim s as N ptr = form.load("Customer Information") s = ptr.SessionHandle() var = session_variables(s) ? var.A_DB_CURRENT_PATH -> "c:\databases\expressions test\"
